Event.name: Becoming_detached
Event.definition:
<def-root>The Becoming_detached frame covers two situations: a scene in which one thing comes to be physically detached from something else; or a scene in which two things come to be disconnected from each other. In the first, the frame includes an <fen>Item</fen> that detaches from a <fen>Source</fen>, creating an asymmetric relationship between the Item and the <fen>Source</fen>. In the second, the <fen>Items</fen> detach from each other, where each serves as a <fen>Source</fen> relative to the other, creating a symmetric relationship between the two <fen>Items</fen>. The <fen>Items</fen> that were formerly attached re-appear as the two separate or potentially separate entities that they were throughout.
<ex><fex name="Item">The ship</fex> <m>became</m> <t>decoupled</t> <fex name="Source">from the dock</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Item
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Item</fen> that detaches from the <fen>Source</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Source</fen> identifies the location to which an <fen>Item</fen> was attached before getting detached. </def-root>

Arg.name: Items
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the plural <fen>Items</fen> that are becoming detached from each other, resulting in their separation.
Notice that when the FE <fen>Items</fen> occurs, neither <fen>Item</fen> nor <fen>Source</fen> can occur.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the detaching event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Item</fen> becomes detached.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Item</fen> becomes detached from the <fen>Source</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Item</fen> ends up detached.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: decouple.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate or disengage from something.

lexUnit.name: unhook.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come apart from something after being connected via a hook.

lexUnit.name: unhinge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: detach a door or other hinged item
